intro: Campylospermum zenkeri, commonly known as the Zambesi false hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Campylospermum zenkeri is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
